alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Morris; Somerset; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 2:30AM EST until January 17 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer. In northern New Jersey...Hunterdon, Middlesex, Morris, Somerset, and Sussex. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Morristown, Somerville, Somerset, East Brunswick, Bridgewater, South Brunswick, North Brunswick, Carteret, Dover, Madison, and Hopatcong. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 13. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 20 and 42. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 7 and 53. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 132 and 134. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
